column4: can someone help me when i try to force-reload alsa it gives me lsof: WARNING: can't stat() fuse.gvfs-fuse-daemon file system /home/xbuntu/.gvfs
Output information may be incomplete.
what was the command you used?
alsa fouce-reload | pastebinit
It says "see dmesg"
ls /lib/modules/2.6.38-11-generic-pae/kernel/sound/pci/hda/snd-hda-intel.ko
What did  ls /lib/modules/2.6.38-11-generic-pae/kernel/sound/pci/hda/snd-hda-intel.ko  say?
So you are sure the file does in fact exist?  (Yes.  No.)
dmesg | pastebinit
ls /lib/modules/2.6.38-11-generic-pae/kernel/sound/pci/hda/snd-hda-intel.ko | pastebinit
Maybe you should start by telling us why you are needing to do:   alsa force-reload
Ok it says SOMETHING then.  (It reports to you the file and it's path, therefore confirming to you that the file does, indeed, exist.)
Did you first run alsamixer to see if channels are turned down or muted?
No M or MM  at bottom of collums?
You reinstalled the OS?
Did you see your sound card's ID properly identified in the alsamixer window?
Do this:   cat /dev/urandom > /dev/dsp
It should say  Card: Intel  on the first line and then  Chip: Realtek  on the second line. (In alsamixer window)
Open a terminal and run alsamixer
Do you see the sound card properly identified in upper left corner?
If not, hit F6
What do you mean it is only coming from the subwoofer?
Oh well, I don't know.... but sorry, my time is up.  I must go.
